content.label: I just wanted to thank the developers and say that this game is everything I wanted and was amazing and fun to play
Love the risk + horror mashup.  Very satisfying game no freemium pay to win garbaage.
I currently have an iPhone XR and the little black notch at the top of my screen (where my camera is located) cuts off some of the game and I can’t edit the safezone

Nothing like a pandemic to make this game even more ironic than it is. I like to build up a dream team of MacGuyver-Fighters armed with rocket launchers and Doctors Scalpals and play the next to final round over and over. Largest map and no inconvenient nuclear detonation or government plots ( wow you sure called that one!) to get in the way. It takes a while to build the right team and I have had some truly great ones but every now and then I delete the app because I waste tooooo much time on it. Free to play free to win is the only thing I will play nowadays and this is my fav.

People who say the zombie attacks are too abundant lack common sense. The first one that pops up will be the first to attack. Duh. It goes in order...if you don’t believe play it yourself. You only need to defend one at a time if you pay attention to when the hordes pop up.

TIP: On Impossible difficulty, kill all surrounding zombies and be careful. I recommend letting the hordes take the buildings, and then reclaiming them after. Defending against hordes causes lots of survivor deaths. It’s especially easy with Fearless Reclaim perk.
It’s a fun game and I’ve enjoyed the series, but attempting to complete the true cure ending is unbelievably frustrating and the monkey blood portion is convoluted. Also not a fan of the soundtrack

I love Rebuild 1 and 2.   This title has been on iOS for years now, honestly it’s only by the developers neglect at this point that they have not fixed the issue of the notch.     Based on what it covers up, it makes it more than annoying for me to not want to play.    I will be seeking a refund :-/.
So I’m playing the game on a iPhone X and bc of the way the iPhone X is made there’s a cut off on my screen, doesn’t bother me but just letting people know before they buy it

I absolutely love this game. I’ve been playing Northway’s games since like early 2008. This is the perfect zombie apocalypse management game and the developer is so nice and so sweet. I just got a new iPhone and I bought my favorite rebuild (3) and it’s cut off on the left side where the speaker is when you talk on the phone. I don’t know how to fix it, but it cuts off a lot of the important bits and I was wondering if there was any fix for this?

title.label: Sure, it has a Learning Curve

content.label: Yes, it can take a while to ‘get’ it, but once you do, this game is amazing.  No matter how many times I play it, there is always something new that I find.  I know Sarah and Colin have moved on to VR game development, but I would totally dig a rebuild 4.

I got to the 3rd city before it started to get boring. You start to feel like it’s less strategy than going through the motions. Story line and objectives are also boring. With you didn’t have to start with a new city and same goals every level. Art is cute though.
I have played all of the other rebuilds, and I love how much more they added to this one, it is truly fun nd I even bought it again when I switched to iPhone since it couldn’t cross over 🙃

This game has great potential. I was so close to loving it until I made it so far into the game and I got a quest telling me to leave the town. Basically all the work you did was for nothing because in order to advance you have to take your leader and three other survivors to a new city and leave all your others behind. Worst idea ever. I thought okay I’ll do it at least I still have to old save. Oh but no I don’t it auto saved so I lost my main one. So there I was starting over practically with the survivors I chose to move on, when I came across a group I already had killed in the previous city, if it’s supposed to be the next stage, why the hell do I have to beat the group again? Honestly a terrible idea to have another city. I deleted the game because my time will not be wasted when you force me to leave the survivors I’ve trained and liked.

title.label: Don’t waste money on Freemium MMO’s

content.label: This is a good zombie survival game. It has enough city planning and building without having to worry about some person that paid hundreds of dollars to come in and wipe you off the planet. It’s worth the purchase price for constant replayability.

This is really the main game o play most of the day. Don’t get me wrong, I play more but this is awesome to play. The way of struggling for food and materials, it makes the game even better on the hardest level.

I’ve played the first two on the computer, and had to buy this one and I’m glad I did. I’m always worried I won’t play games I buy, but I keep coming back to this one. 
I love the stories and how each character eventually becomes their own thing with buffs and skills. I like how there are moments where it is overwhelming and then calms to recover, being difficult but not too overwhelming. And it’s unique, which is so hard to do these days! Love it.

title.label: One of the best games I’ve played

content.label: I’ve had this app for a year now and I can’t stop playing it!  This is one of the best apps I’ve ever had! I can’t believe a major company didn’t make this it is so good!

I have been playing Rebuild since the 1st one and I’ve seen it evolve. I enjoy the new features and replay value. The massed zombies could be a little too much sometimes and it takes switching survivors around for a while. Other than that great game. Thank you

I’ve played the first one and it was fun. This unfortunately seems not to be optimized for the Xs notch and thus hinders your ability to view some items pretty heavily. As soon as that’s updated I want to give it a fair shot

Lots of fun and really addictive.

Just one thing, can you please remove the error about the game center connection when game center is disabled (as someone who never uses game center). It doesn't take more than a second to dismiss it but gets annoying to deal with each time I launch the game. Thanks!

I’ve had an iPhone since they came out. I’ve played hundreds of games on the App Store. This is the funnest and most original game I’ve played and that’s including my home consoles. Great, great, great job. As soon as I complete everything, I jus start it back up and do it again. I would recommend this to anyone.

This game is a painful crawl you won't have the access to most techs for a long time. So you can't play how you want to. It would be a much better game if it allowed regular chars 2 abilities they could lvl instead of only 1 of 5. So many annoyances in this game drag it down. I would not recommend this game to anyone.
It was really fun but takes forever to finish. I got very frustrated at the end when I didn’t get the ending I wanted.

title.label: Quite uneven and a bit bias.

content.label: On the event of having children’s, it give birth of babies, but it favors some couples over others, so as a result few couple give birth, and huge amount don’t at all.

This game is a lot of fun and is a great concept. However, the zombie attacks are constant. You spend so much time fighting them off that you can’t reclaim any buildings or search for supplies to even attempt to. I’m not deleting it YET. But please patch it or something. It’s tip-toeing the line between challenging and too annoying to play.
Y’know I do still play this game, so it’s nice that you guys do find time to update the game. Although it would be even better if y’all could get into some mo’ games if not a another sequel.
I *Just* started playing again the other day and lamented the lack of iPhone X support - but it’s here now!!!!!

title.label: First level is fun, after that it's terrible

content.label: I can't do anything in this game.. all I can do is shift my survivors around the base to defend against the massed zombies. Not fun at all. I am guessing there are a lot of fake reviews on here.

Rebuild 3 artwork is amazing. It have more stuff to do than the previous rebuild. However, not many cool clothes/building/weapons to craft/build. 
The ability to build the unlock building, require the research lab. Due to random events happening, the unique building chances of getting destroy is 50%. 
Sadly can't be rebuild lol, rebuild.......

I played rebuild and rebuild 2 online and loved them, for a free online game they were pretty good. I bought both the rebuild games on the App Store but I didn’t play this one for a while because of how different it was from the first two, it was a little tricky for me starting out but once I have it a chance I was hooked. For a mobile game and the little amount of money it cost, it is very very worth it. I played through the first time in about a week playing whenever I had the chance. 
It’s worth the 5 stars but the different endings can be very difficult. I’ve looked for walkthroughs and only found one that seems legitimate, it would be nicer if the random events that ultimately effect the outcome of the game, would be more obvious. I’m not asking for easy peasy, just to be aware of the things I need to do so I can do them.

I’m really torn between 4 and 5 stars because it really is amazing, even with the difficulty in figuring out how to get the different endings. I haven’t been disappoint by any of the rebuild games and look forward to any future projects in this series.
It’s now on steam so I plan to buy that whenever I can :)
It is hard sometimes but I eventually catch on
Extremely fun at first then you get bored

Great game, difficulty really ramps from easy to medium and so on.
I like that survivor happiness, friendships, and preferences are factored in, although sometimes the reasons for low happiness can be a bit annoying and impossible to really compensate for(fort was better when it was small, zed will always be out, there aren't enough places to get a stiff drink....yet you will have 9 or ten bars being tended). 
Interacting with factions and dealing with waves of zombies can be frustrating st higher difficulties, but more than adds to the tension.
It took waaayyy longer than I expected, but unlocking all the endings is a real slog, bordering on tedious. I don't mind exploration and attention to detail, but having RNG controlled events with zero indicators that it may or may not be important, but ultimately will rule out  a specific ending is fairly annoying. I grew up in the Nintendo/Atari era, I can appreciate difficulty, steep learning curves, focus on exploration, and not getting your hand held...just having a chain of random events with absurdly specific requirements that sound like all the made up stuff people post about bringing Aeris back to life in FF7 is disappointing.
All in all, it's a great game, absolutely worth checking out.
I want a refund
The game on computer was good, having it on iOS is amazing!
Loved the first one, and this one has more content... definitely a fun time-waster.

Love it so much. I've wasted many happy hours on this game. Lots of fun. (Wish that whole monkey blood thing wasn't quite so complex - I still haven't gotten that to work). But even so, really enjoyed this one. Thank you.
Fun strategy game that kept me interested for 8 hours. However, once you get the hang of it the game is rinse and repeat.
Would love to try Rebuild 4, for those who love turn based games this is it. Game can be played fast or slow you decide. Replayed many times.

Played the original online many years ago. Was happy to see this. But the balance of having to defend and build with such frequent zombie attack on normal is ridiculous. I can't get anything done because there can only be one mission on a plot at a time and there's always zombies attacking from each side. And that's on NORMAL. I shudder at trying to play hard. I didn't want it easy as pie but jeez, there's not even any leeway. Just constant masses of zombies from all sides.
The game is super boring and kinda complicated. You assign a survivor a place and then just wait. Was looking for something with more action! This game is not for everyone!

Rebuild 3 is a must-have for anyone who likes micro-managing games like Sim City or Rollercoaster Tycoon. The basic premise is that you are leading a group of survivors in a post-zombie outbreak. You recruit survivors, train them, deploy them where most needed. Your group must scavenge for supplies and expand its territory. You have to balance resources and personalities. Diplomacy and war with other factions of survivors plays a big role. Oh, and you might want to look for a cure for this zombie thing. The game is incredibly deep and will take more than 100 hours to finish. Replay ability is high. This is just a masterpiece of an iOS title.
There is many different options for the paths you want to take, I would recommend

title.label: One of my Favorite IOS games of all time

content.label: There are a ton of games out there and I will say that this one deserves to be in the top 100. It's very neatly designed because everything can lead to something else. I like the research ability and being able too learn stories from the survivors. I definitely believe that this could be one of the best thought out IOS games of all time.
the game is good but my stuck on the loading screen please help

I downloaded this a week ago and it was working fine on my IPhone 5C. Now that the new update installed my game is stuck on the load menu and when I hear the sound to load me in the game, it still shows me the loading screen. I will change my review to 5 stars when I can play this properly.
Make another but to where there are more choices

title.label: Not worth the massive time investment

content.label:
Rebuild 3 is all about the strategic choices that you make, and at the end of the day there is enjoyment to be found. The problem is that that enjoyment is hidden behind a thick layer of tedium.

You scout a building, then you scavenge it for supplies, then you clear it of zombies, then you take it over, then rinse and repeat for the next building. Well, unless the next building has a large enough mass of zombies that you need to send your combat specialists to clear them out, but you can't send them out because you have them garrisoned against a large zombie attack on your settlement, so you need to wait a long while until you can progress. You also won't want to take over a building if it has a recruitable survivor inside, whom you would try to persuade to join your settlement except your avatar is in the hospital for a whole week because he/she was bitten by a diseased raccoon while dumpster diving, even though you had them reading up on leadership books in your reclaimed schoolhouse. Or maybe you do manage to recruit the survivor, who turns out to be of a class that's useless or of which you were completely overloaded with already.

Still, as I said, there is enjoyment to be had- when I finished the stage, I did get a sense of accomplishment out of it. Then I looked at the time, realized it had taken me 90 minutes to finish the stage, and decided that the small enjoyment at the end was absolutely not worth the time investment and all of the tedious gameplay that led to it. I would only recommend this game if you need to kill a lot of time and have nothing better to do.
Do not buy this game if you liked any of the old rebuilds. Everything is so cluttered. What a waste of $5.
This game is so addicting! Make sure you don't play to long or you will become a zombie!
